intro: Alsophila costalisora, commonly known as the slender tree fern, is a species native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and a crown of feathery fronds that can reach several meters in length. The plant belongs to the family Cyatheaceae and is known for its slow growth and long lifespan. Its fronds are typically dimorphic, with sterile and fertile fronds differing in structure and appearance. Alsophila costalisora plays an important ecological role in forest ecosystems, providing habitat and contributing to soil stability.
